solution: Check if the server is running and reachable.
Ensure Plugin X is compatible with your Minecraft version.
Check if the ItemLocksFabric mod is client-side only, you should remove this from your server.
Your server has run out of memory, you may need to upgrade your server's RAM, or reduce the number of plugins or mods you are using.
This error occurs when there is an incompatible class cast in your code or libraries. Check your plugins and mods for compatibility or update your Java version.
A required file is missing. Check your modpack or server files for missing or corrupted files.
This indicates a recursive loop in your code or a plugin. Disable recent changes or plugins to debug the issue.

pattern: java\.util\.zip\.ZipException: error in opening zip file
solution: A mod or plugin is corrupted. Re-download the affected mod/plugin and replace it on the server.
A mod, plugin, or configuration error is causing the server to crash during a tick. Check recent changes and logs for details.
A plugin or mod is trying to access an invalid object. Update or remove problematic plugins/mods.
A required mod is missing. Ensure all mod dependencies are installed and correctly configured.
A player or the server is experiencing network issues. Check the server's network configuration or the player's internet connection.
The port the server is trying to use is already occupied. Ensure no other server or application is using the same port.
The server is running an older version than the client. Update the server to match the client's version.
The client is running an older version than the server. Update the client to match the server's version.

pattern: You need to agree to the EULA
solution: Open the 'eula.txt' file in your server directory and change 'eula=false' to 'eula=true' after reviewing the agreement.

pattern: This crash report has been saved to:
solution: The server has generated a crash report. Open the crash report file for more details about the issue.
The server address could not be resolved. Check your DNS settings or ensure the server address is correct.
Check if Mojang authentication servers are down or if the server is set to 'online-mode=true' in the server.properties file.
A problematic entity is causing the server to crash. Use tools like MCEdit to remove problematic entities.
The server is experiencing performance issues. Reduce the number of entities, plugins, or players, or allocate more resources to the server.

pattern: java\.lang\.IllegalArgumentException: Chunk .* is already being loaded
solution: A corrupted chunk is causing issues. Use chunk-fixing tools or remove the chunk manually.
A mod or plugin is referencing a missing or invalid recipe. Update mods/plugins or check for missing dependencies.
A mod or plugin is missing a required library. Ensure all dependencies are installed.
A plugin is trying to access an unsupported feature. Update the plugin or check for compatibility issues.
